page.title: 04Home life in Gretton
page.content: Mr.and Mrs.Parman moved to 13,Stafford Road, Gretton in August 1977 because they liked the idea of living in a village not too far from Corby, where they both worked. Also the price of the house was within their financial limits and they were not concerned about there being no gas connected to the village. Stafford Road is part of "The new estate" as the locals call it, because it is at the edge of the village. It is made up of one long, winding road with 3 cul-de-sacs going off it. Many of the dwellings are ideally situated for open views over the countryside, ours included. We are very happy here, especially because of the situation of the house,across from the recreation field,2 minutes walk away.There are many organisations within the village and it is a thriving,community.
